proper noun.description: A city in north central England, on the Derwent River; population 244,700 (est. 2009).

noun.description: An annual horse race for three-year-olds, founded in 1780 by the 12th Earl of Derby. The race is run on Epsom Downs in England in late May or early June.
A boot or shoe having the eyelet tabs stitched on top of the vamp.
